title: filter out OrbotHelper.ACTION_STATUS Intents when they slip in
message:
filter out OrbotHelper.ACTION_STATUS Intents when they slip in

Something is going awry causing the ACTION_STATUS Intents to be processed
as if they contained the data URL.  For now, just make sure they are
ignored rather than crashing.

message:
create UseTorActivity superclass to handle tor receiver tricks

There is going to be a bunch of tricks needed to handle Tor smoothly, when
considering starting, installing, etc.  so make a superclass that handles
all that for Activities that need to Tor to work.

This drives the getting of URLs from the internet by the status of Tor in
Orbot.  So it will try to start Tor and wait until its started before
fetching the URL from the internet.

title: fix LongLogTag lint error to make a shorter lint result
message: fix LongLogTag lint error to make a shorter lint result

title: android:gravity="start" works on older platforms too
message:
android:gravity="start" works on older platforms too

According to Android lint:

Note: For `Gravity#LEFT` and `Gravity#START`, you can use these constants
even when targeting older platforms, because the `start` bitmask is a
superset of the `left` bitmask. Therefore, you can use `gravity="start"`
rather than `gravity="left|start"`.

title: include icons from Orbot and OsmAnd in install buttons
message: include icons from Orbot and OsmAnd in install buttons

title: wrap the whole main screen in a ScrollView so all content is accessible
message: wrap the whole main screen in a ScrollView so all content is accessible

title: show warning on main screen if there is no app that handles geo: URIs
message:
show warning on main screen if there is no app that handles geo: URIs

This app uses geo: URIs to send the location to the map app.  If there is
no app installed that can handle a geo: URI, LocationPrivacy cannot do
anything.

title: set up transifex client for automatic push and pull
message: set up transifex client for automatic push and pull

title: make-release-build: always build current commit, and mark APK accordingly
message:
make-release-build: always build current commit, and mark APK accordingly

Instead of forcing the build to the most recent signed tag, just build the
current commit and name the APK accordingly to make it clear whether it is
a real release or not.

title: support Right-To-Left languages with icon placement in menu buttons
message: support Right-To-Left languages with icon placement in menu buttons

title: fix Google Maps URL parsing for all known URLS
message:
fix Google Maps URL parsing for all known URLS

This fixes the FIXME URLs, and adds a new URL with the query name in the
fragment.

title: support parsing all Google Maps URLs
message:
support parsing all Google Maps URLs

This adds support for hosts like:
* www.google.com.tr
* www.google.co.uk

and many more...

title: when a URL is unparsable after all tricks, give Chooser or Blocked message
message:
when a URL is unparsable after all tricks, give Chooser or Blocked message

If the user has chosen to block all location links, then the chooser should
not be shown.  Otherwise, when parsing fails, offer the user a choice of
whether to try with an untrusted app.  Ultimately, there should be a pref
that lets the user decide the endgame when parsing a URL fails: either
block it, or put up a chooser.

title: update to latest GeoPointParserUtil from OsmAnd
message: update to latest GeoPointParserUtil from OsmAnd

title: remove duplicate IntentFilter for maps.google.com
message: remove duplicate IntentFilter for maps.google.com

title: add a progress dialog when fetching location information from the net
message:
add a progress dialog when fetching location information from the net

It can take a while to get the info from the net, especially via Tor, so
there needs to be a progress dialog showing the user that something is
happening.

title: create App.getHttpURLConnection() to support proxying when Orbot is present
message:
create App.getHttpURLConnection() to support proxying when Orbot is present

This creates a central, static method for getting HttpURLConnections that
are properly configured for proxying and other things.  This will be
expanded to also to stronger HTTPS configuration.

title: hook up UI to OrbotHelper to prompt user to install/start Orbot
message:
hook up UI to OrbotHelper to prompt user to install/start Orbot

If Orbot is not running, then this app should request that it to start.  In
that case, this app should wait until Orbot is started before trying to
process the URL in the incoming Intent via the network.

title: include NetCipher as Android Library Project to support Orbot/Tor
message: include NetCipher as Android Library Project to support Orbot/Tor

title: handle when apps are removed, added, or on an SDCard that is un/available
message:
handle when apps are removed, added, or on an SDCard that is un/available

* if the user installs OsmAnd, select it as the default app
* if the user uninstalls the selected app, switch to "Chooser"
* if the selected app is on the SDCard:
  * when SDCard is removed, temporarily set to "Chooser"
  * when SDCard is put back in, reset to original preference

title: hook up all actions to the Blocked/Chooser/TrustedApp preference
message:
hook up all actions to the Blocked/Chooser/TrustedApp preference

This actually does the work!  Now the action chosen by the user on the main
screen will now actually take effect when the user clicks on location links

title: if no app store found, just go to http://osmand.net to install OsmAnd
message: if no app store found, just go to http://osmand.net to install OsmAnd

title: create Prefs class with easy static methods for getting and setting
message:
create Prefs class with easy static methods for getting and setting

This pattern makes it far easier to actually get and set preferences within
the Activities, instead of getDefaultSharedPreferences() everywhere...

title: rename "None" to "Blocked" to better describe the function
message: rename "None" to "Blocked" to better describe the function

title: merge all dynamic screen measurement into common code
message:
merge all dynamic screen measurement into common code

This syncs up the layout of the popup menu and the Button.  The Drawable
bounds are now set before the Drawable is stored, rather than on each use.

title: store selected app in a SharedPreference, and load in onResume()
message: store selected app in a SharedPreference, and load in onResume()

title: create a common setSelectedApp() method to do everything needed
message:
create a common setSelectedApp() method to do everything needed

This method sets the selected packageName and sets up the Button to display
the app icon and name.

It seems some apps provide the wrong size icon, like OsmAnd, so this code
forces the size of the icon, and dynamically adjusts the Button padding to
match.

title: switch TrustedAppEntry to accept ActivityInfo for flexibility
message:
switch TrustedAppEntry to accept ActivityInfo for flexibility

ActivityInfo is actually the required data type, not ResolveInfo, and there
are many ways to get ActivityInfo instances.

title: if OsmAnd is not installed, prompt user to install it
message:
if OsmAnd is not installed, prompt user to install it

OsmAnd is the only map app that really works fully offline, and it will
soon have Tor/proxy support, so its the most private map app I've seen.

title: create "Trusted App" chooser to selecting the map app to redirect to
message:
create "Trusted App" chooser to selecting the map app to redirect to

To make this app more usable, this will give the user the option to set the
map app that Location Privacy should use to display incoming location URLs.
It also has the option for "Chooser" to show the standard Android chooser,
or "None" to just ignore location links entirely.

This is not hooked up to anything yet, it is just the UI.

title: do not include BUILD.MF in debug APK, it breaks signature verification
message:
do not include BUILD.MF in debug APK, it breaks signature verification

For some strange reason, including a BUILD file in a debug APK breaks the
signature verification, but works fine in the release APK.  This is the
error:

jarsigner: java.lang.SecurityException: invalid SHA1 signature file digest for res/drawable-xxhdpi-v4/abc_list_selector_disabled_holo_dark.9.png

title: close HttpClient when done using it to prevent leak
message:
close HttpClient when done using it to prevent leak

AndroidHttpClient provides the handy close() method.  This fixes this:

     AndroidHttpClient  E  Leak found
                        E  java.lang.IllegalStateException: AndroidHttpClient created and never closed
                        E      at android.net.http.AndroidHttpClient.<init>(AndroidHttpClient.java:158)
                        E      at android.net.http.AndroidHttpClient.newInstance(AndroidHttpClient.java:144)
                        E      at android.net.http.AndroidHttpClient.newInstance(AndroidHttpClient.java:153)
                        E      at info.guardianproject.locationprivacy.QQMapUriActivity$ParseHtmlAsyncTask.doInBackground(QQMapUriActivity.java:85)
                        E      at info.guardianproject.locationprivacy.QQMapUriActivity$ParseHtmlAsyncTask.doInBackground(QQMapUriActivity.java:1)
                        E      at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:288)
                        E      at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:237)
                        E      at android.os.AsyncTask$SerialExecutor$1.run(AsyncTask.java:231)
                        E      at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1112)
                        E      at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:587)
                        E      at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:841)

title: support all Google country-specific domains
message:
support all Google country-specific domains

Wow, there are a lot:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Google_domains

I used this regexp to generate the list from the above page's HTML:
sed -n 's,.* href="http://\(google.[a-z.]*\)".*,<data android:host="www.\1" />,gp' en.wikipedia.org\ wiki\ List_of_Google_domains.html

title: parse all Google Maps links, including short links
message:
parse all Google Maps links, including short links

This first tries to parse the location from the URL itself, and if that
fails, it tries to first parse the location from the Redirect URL, then
it tries to get the JSON from Google, and parse that.  The JSON stuff
probably doesn't really work yet, but the rest does.

refs #4395 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4395

title: get the location from a URI by reading the Redirect HTTP header
message:
get the location from a URI by reading the Redirect HTTP header

A lot of location shortlinks are just a standard HTTP Redirect, so it is
easy to just ask for the HTTP Header, and grab the Redirect URI from it.
Then the location is then parsed from that URI.

message: nail down description, and include XLIFF and app_description versions

message: add latest appcompat/v7 from Android Support

title: update GeoPointParserUtil to get GeoParsedPoint.toString() outputting geo:
message:
update GeoPointParserUtil to get GeoParsedPoint.toString() outputting geo:

This allows for the GeoParsedPoint to act as a URI converter, since
GeoPointParserUtil.parse() will convert any location URI into a
GeoParsedPoint and then GeoParsedPoint.toString() will output it as a geo:

title: some location URLs cannot be parsed or fetched, so offer "Force HTTPS"
message:
some location URLs cannot be parsed or fetched, so offer "Force HTTPS"

Some services use HTTP links to share location, but the location cannot be
parsed from the URL, nor cannot it be fetched from the site itself without
substantial code.  Glympse is one such service, since the shared URL is a
link to a person's location feed, which is Glympse's proprietary system.

closes #4401 https://dev.guardianproject.info/issues/4401

title: parse all sorts of map/location links, and re-share them as secure OSM link
message:
parse all sorts of map/location links, and re-share them as secure OSM link

This claims all sorts of map/location links with IntentFilters, then parses
the lat/lon/zoom out of them, then creates a new Intent with an HTTPS link
to OpenStreetMap with the same location.

Also import URL parsing utilities from OsmAnd project:
https://github.com/osmandapp/Osmand

title: add README
message: add README

title: add GPLv3 as license
message: add GPLv3 as license

title: intercept download.osmand.net URIs
message:
intercept download.osmand.net URIs

Intercept these URIs and translate them into direct links to OpenStreetMap
using HTTPS.  This is to ensure the least amount of data leakage possible.

Also included is the logic for creating OpenStreetMap short URLs, but on
Android, apps don't recognize that URI format, so its not used here at the
moment.

title: add IntentFilter to filter OpenStreetMap URIs for privacy
message:
add IntentFilter to filter OpenStreetMap URIs for privacy

This just serves as an optionally transparent filter for all OpenStreetMap
URIs to make sure that they are using HTTPS.
